definition.ESRF_description: Techniques used to collect this dataset

technique_pid.ESRF_description: List of space-separated techniques identifiers used to collect this dataset, eg. PaNET ids

doi_users.ESRF_description: Users of the DOI. Comma separated string

machine.ESRF_description: Name of the machine that collects the data

software.ESRF_description: Name of the software that collects the data

group_by.ESRF_description: Comma separated list of parameters name that will be used to represent the data acquisition as a tree. Mostly for visualization purposes

definition.ESRF_description: Technique used to collect this dataset

sample_type.ESRF_description: It can be buffer or sample

run_number.ESRF_description: It can be buffer or sample

experiment_type.ESRF_description: It the kind of experiment: sample changer or HPLC

rg.ESRF_description: Calculated radious of giration. It can be calculated with Gnom or BIFT

rg_avg.ESRF_description: Calculated average of radious of giration

d_max.ESRF_description: maximum particle dimension. it is the largest distance between any two points within the particle and is a crucial parameter in SAXS analysis.

porod_volume.ESRF_description: The Porod volume is an estimate of the molecular volume of a particle derived from SAXS data. It is obtained using the Porod invariant, which is related to the scattering intensity at high angles.

porod_MM_volume_estimation.ESRF_description: molecular weight (MW) of a macromolecule in solution using the Porod volume

vc.ESRF_description: The Volume of Correlation is a SAXS-derived parameter that provides an alternative estimate of the molecular volume of a biomolecule.

chi2r.ESRF_description: goodness of fit between experimental scattering data and a theoretical model or fit.

kappa_settings_id.ESRF_description: Identifier used to distinguished between multiple kappa setting within the same data collection

beamSizeAtSampleX.ESRF_description: Horizontal beam size in mm at sample position

beamSizeAtSampleY.ESRF_description: Vertical beam size in mm at sample position

detectorDistance.ESRF_description: Distance from detector to sample position

flux.ESRF_description: Photon flux at the sample position

fluxEnd.ESRF_description: Flux in photon/s before data collection

resolution.ESRF_description: Resolution at the edge of the detector

resolution_at_corner.ESRF_description: Resolution at the corner of the detector

position_id.ESRF_description: Identifier of the position within the crystal

crystalPositionName.ESRF_description: Centered position, line and grid ID

source.ESRF_description: Describes the pdb suource: Alphafold, user, unit cell

search_model.ESRF_description: Identifier to the search model. It can be a link

PNG_2FOFC.ESRF_description: snapshot of the ligand in 2FO-FC electron density

PNG_FOFC.ESRF_description: snapshot of the ligand in FO-FC electron density

GIF_file.ESRF_description: animated GIF of the ligand in FO-FC electron density

start_image_number.ESRF_description: First image number of the integration

end_image_number.ESRF_description: Last image number of the integration

rotation_axis_x.ESRF_description: X position of the rotation axis

rotation_axis_y.ESRF_description: Y position of the rotation axis

rotation_axis_z.ESRF_description: Z position of the rotation axis

diffraction_limit_direction_1.ESRF_description: Diffraction limits (Ang.) of the ellipsoid fitted to the diffraction cut-off surface as direction cosines relative to the orthonormal basis (standard PDB convention), and also in terms of reciprocal unit-cell vectors

diffraction_limit_direction_2.ESRF_description: Diffraction limits (Ang.) of the ellipsoid fitted to the diffraction cut-off surface as direction cosines relative to the orthonormal basis (standard PDB convention), and also in terms of reciprocal unit-cell vectors

diffraction_limit_direction_3.ESRF_description: Diffraction limits (Ang.) of the ellipsoid fitted to the diffraction cut-off surface as direction cosines relative to the orthonormal basis (standard PDB convention), and also in terms of reciprocal unit-cell vectors

principal_axis_1.ESRF_description: Corresponding principal axes of the ellipsoid fitted to the diffraction cut-off surface as direction cosines relative to the orthonormal basis (standard PDB convention), and also in terms of reciprocal unit-cell vectors

principal_axis_2.ESRF_description: Corresponding principal axes of the ellipsoid fitted to the diffraction cut-off surface as direction cosines relative to the orthonormal basis (standard PDB convention), and also in terms of reciprocal unit-cell vectors

principal_axis_3.ESRF_description: Corresponding principal axes of the ellipsoid fitted to the diffraction cut-off surface as direction cosines relative to the orthonormal basis (standard PDB convention), and also in terms of reciprocal unit-cell vectors

propagation.ESRF_description: Propagation may be near or far

beamSize.ESRF_description: Beam size on the sample in microns

name.ESRF_description: Scan motor in the horizontal direction

range.ESRF_description: Range of the moves in microns

name.ESRF_description: Scan motor in the vertical direction

range.ESRF_description: Range of the moves in microns

xshutter_time.ESRF_description: Shutter closing time for the detector

images_per_step.ESRF_description: Number of images captured per step

images_at_end_as_quali.ESRF_description: Use images at end of scan for quality check

live_correction.ESRF_description: Enable live correction of dark fields

mono_tune_on_ref.ESRF_description: Tune monochromator before capturing flat images

open_slits_on_quali.ESRF_description: Open slits for quality check images

flat_power.ESRF_description: Power of the motor for capturing flat images

safe_time.ESRF_description: Extra time to ensure safe readout

shift_turns.ESRF_description: Number of rotation turns to shift

interlaced_roundtrip.ESRF_description: Interlaced scanning: same or opposite directions

x_pixel_n.ESRF_description: Number of pixels in the x-direction

y_pixel_n.ESRF_description: Number of pixels in the y-direction

voi_dose.ESRF_description: Radiation dose within the volume of interest (VOI)

total_voi_dose.ESRF_description: Total accumulated dose within the volume of interest (VOI)

reference_description.ESRF_description: Approach used to generate reference frames for flat field subtraction

scanRadix.ESRF_description: Common prefix for scan datasets, useful for locating original radiographs

propagationDistance.ESRF_description: Distance between the sample and detector

xStages.ESRF_description: Number of scans in x-direction; allows 3D mosaic scans

yStages.ESRF_description: Number of scans in y-direction; allows 3D mosaic scans

zStages.ESRF_description: Number of scans in z-direction; allows 3D mosaic scans

min32to16bits.ESRF_description: Min value for scaling 32-bit float to 16-bit unsigned integer

max32to16bits.ESRF_description: Max value for scaling 32-bit float to 16-bit unsigned integer

technique.ESRF_description: Technique used for hierarchical phase-contrast tomography

flat_on.ESRF_description: Interval for capturing flat field images

y_step.ESRF_description: Translation step size in the Y-axis for flat images

z_step.ESRF_description: Translation step size in the Z-axis for flat images

start_angle.ESRF_description: Start angle of the tomographic acquisition

type.ESRF_description: Acquisition type (e.g., half, full, or quarter acquisition)

camera_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Pixel size of the camera hardware

sample_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Pixel size in the sample space after all magnifications

optic_magnified_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Pixel size in the sample space after magnification of the optics

beam_magnification.ESRF_description: Magnification factor from the beam divergence

scan_type.ESRF_description: Type of scan used for the projection scan (e.g. INTERLACED, STEP, CONTINUOUS)

acc_frames_count.ESRF_description: Number of frames in accumulation mode

accel_disp.ESRF_description: Acceleration displacement for the rotation stage

beam_check.ESRF_description: Suspend scan if no beam is detected

camera_x_mot.ESRF_description: Motor for moving the camera along the beam axis

latency_time.ESRF_description: Extra readout time for the camera

no_images_at_end.ESRF_description: Capture of images at the end of scan disabled

no_flat_at_end.ESRF_description: Capture of flat images at the end of scan disabled

duration.ESRF_description: Time it took for the acquisition sequence to run

z_start.ESRF_description: Initial position of the motor on the Z-axis (first stage)

z_delta.ESRF_description: Incremental value for the Z-axis stage

z_n_steps.ESRF_description: Number of steps for the Z-axis stage

duration.ESRF_description: Time it took for the acquisition z-series sequence to run

angle_offset.ESRF_description: Angle offset for the reconstruction in degrees

angles_file.ESRF_description: File path for angles used in reconstruction

axis_correction_file.ESRF_description: File path for axis correction data

centered_axis.ESRF_description: Whether the reconstruction is centered on the axis

clip_outer_circle.ESRF_description: Whether to clip the outer circle of the reconstruction

cor_options.ESRF_description: Options for center of rotation correction

end_x.ESRF_description: End X coordinate (in pixels) for reconstruction

end_y.ESRF_description: End Y coordinate (in pixels) for reconstruction

end_z.ESRF_description: End Z coordinate (in pixels) for reconstruction

fbp_filter_cutoff.ESRF_description: Cutoff frequency for the FBP filter

preconditioning_filter.ESRF_description: Preconditioning filter applied to the reconstruction

rotation_axis_position.ESRF_description: Position of the rotation axis in pixels

start_x.ESRF_description: Start X coordinate (in pixels) for reconstruction

start_y.ESRF_description: Start Y coordinate (in pixels) for reconstruction

start_z.ESRF_description: Start Z coordinate (in pixels) for reconstruction

translation_movements_file.ESRF_description: File path for translation movements data

ctf_advanced_params.ESRF_description: Advanced parameters for CTF phase retrieval

unsharp_method.ESRF_description: Unsharp method used for phase retrieval

sampleDetectorDistances.ESRF_description: Sample/detector distances for all planes used

sourceSampleDistances.ESRF_description: Source/sample distances for all planes used

im01NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 1

im01NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 1

im02NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 2

im02NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 2

im03NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 3

im03NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 3

im04NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 4

im04NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 4

ref01NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 1

ref02NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 2

ref02NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first reference image in plane 2

ref03NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 3

ref03NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first reference image in plane 3

ref04NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 4

ref04NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first reference image in plane 4

pixelSize.ESRF_description: Pixel size of first distance in micron

definition.ESRF_description: Technique used to collect this dataset

exposureTime.ESRF_description: Requested exposure time per diffraction pattern

sampleVibration.ESRF_description: The vibration speed of the powder sample (0-100 %)

beamSizeVertical.ESRF_description: Vertical beam size on the sample in microns

beamSizeHorizontal.ESRF_description: Horizontal beam size on the sample in microns

beamSizeVertical.ESRF_description: Vertical beam size on the sample in microns

beamSizeHorizontal.ESRF_description: Horizontal beam size on the sample in microns

detector_tilts.ESRF_description: Detector tilts around X, Y and Z axes

rotation_axis.ESRF_description: Name of the rotation axis (e.g., omega)

rotation_range.ESRF_description: Rotation range for the crystal scan (start,end)

group.ESRF_description: Description and metadata about the physical sample used in the experiment.
group.name: ${Sample_name}

distance.ESRF_description: Translation of the sample along the Z-direction of the laboratory coordinate system

support.ESRF_description: Name of the support used to collect the sample. It can be a chip, plate, jet, etc...

situation.ESRF_description: The atmosphere will be one of the components, which is where its details will be stored; the relevant components will be indicated by the entry in the sample_component member.

ub_matrix.ESRF_description: UB matrix of single crystal sample using Busing-Levy convention: W. R. Busing and H. A. Levy (1967). Acta Cryst. 22, 457-464. This is the multiplication of the orientation_matrix, given above, with the BB matrix which can be derived from the lattice constants.

name.ESRF_description: Name (or ideally identifier) for a batch (series of data collections)

institute.ESRF_description: Institute of origin of the patient

name.ESRF_description: Apparatus identification code/model number; e.g. OC100 011

type.ESRF_description: Type of apparatus. This could be the SE codes in scheduling database; e.g. OC/100

description.ESRF_description: Description of the apparatus; e.g. 100mm bore orange cryostat with Roots pump

name.ESRF_description: Name of the parcel where the sample has been shipped

storage_condition.ESRF_description: Storage conditions of the parcel. Example: -80 degrees

type.ESRF_description: Type of container. Example: unipuck, spinepuck, etc...

position.ESRF_description: Position of the sample within the container

name.ESRF_description: Name of the container where the sample is. Example: puck_name

collection_number.ESRF_description: Collection number in the repository institution

fabrication.ESRF_description: how the zone plate was manufactured. Any of these values: etched | plated | zone doubled | other

zone_support_material.ESRF_description: Material present between the zones. This is usually only present for the “zone doubled” fabrication process

description.ESRF_description: Declares which child group contains a path leading to a NXdata group. It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.

vertical.ESRF_description: Optional description/label. Probably only present if we are an additional reference point for components rather than the location of a real component.

component_index.ESRF_description: Position of the component along the beam path. The sample is at 0, components upstream have negative component_index, components downstream have positive component_index.

type.ESRF_description: Any of these values: single: mirror with a single material as a reflecting surface, multi: mirror with stacked, multiple layers as a reflecting surface

interior_atmosphere.ESRF_description: Any of these values: vacuum | helium | argon

vertical.ESRF_description: Optional description/label. Probably only present if we are an additional reference point for components rather than the location of a real component.

component_index.ESRF_description: Position of the component along the beam path. The sample is at 0, components upstream have negative component_index, components downstream have positive component_index.

incident_beam_divergence.ESRF_description: Beam crossfire in degrees parallel to the laboratory X axis

horizontal_incident_beam_divergence.ESRF_description: Horizontal beam crossfire in degrees parallel to the laboratory X axis

vertical_incident_beam_divergence.ESRF_description: Vertical beam crossfire in degrees parallel to the laboratory X axis

final_polarization.ESRF_description: Polarization vector on leaving beamline component using Stokes notation (see incident_polarization_stokes).

distance.ESRF_description: Effective distance from sample Distance as seen by radiation from sample. This number should be negative to signify that it is upstream of the sample.

type.ESRF_description: type of radiation source (pick one from the enumerated list and spell exactly). Spallation Neutron Source, Pulsed Reactor Neutron Source, Reactor Neutron Source, Synchrotron X-ray Source, Pulsed Muon Source, Rotating Anode X-ray, Fixed Tube X-ray, UV Laser, Free-Electron Laser, Optical Laser, Ion Source, UV Plasma Source

energy.ESRF_description: Energy emitted in a single pulse. https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/base_classes/NXsource.html#nxsource-energy-field

wavelength.ESRF_description: Wavelength emitted in a single pulse.

pulse_width.ESRF_description: Time between the start and end of a single pulse. https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/base_classes/NXsource.html#nxsource-pulse-width-field

delay.ESRF_description: The time of the start of the laser pulse with respect to the start of the measurement (T=0)

energy.ESRF_description: Energy emitted in a single pulse. https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/base_classes/NXsource.html#nxsource-energy-field

wavelength.ESRF_description: Wavelength emitted in a single pulse.

pulse_width.ESRF_description: Time between the start and end of a single pulse. https://manual.nexusformat.org/classes/base_classes/NXsource.html#nxsource-pulse-width-field

delay.ESRF_description: The time of the start of the laser pulse with respect to the start of the measurement (T=0)

lens_geometry.ESRF_description: Geometry of the lens. Any of these values:paraboloid,spherical,elliptical,hyperbolical

focus_type.ESRF_description: The type of focus of the lens. Any of these values:line,point

curvature.ESRF_description: Radius of the curvature as measured in the middle of the lens

number_of_lenses.ESRF_description: Number of lenses that make up the compound lens

lens_material.ESRF_description: Material used to make the lens

number_of_lenses.ESRF_description: Number of lenses that make up the compound lens

lens_material.ESRF_description: Material used to make the lens

lens_geometry.ESRF_description: Geometry of the lens. Any of these values:paraboloid,spherical,elliptical,hyperbolical

focus_type.ESRF_description: The type of focus of the lens. Any of these values:line,point

curvature.ESRF_description: Radius of the curvature as measured in the middle of the lens

number_of_lenses.ESRF_description: Number of lenses that make up the compound lens

lens_material.ESRF_description: Material used to make the lens

type.ESRF_description: Description of type such as He3 gas cylinder, He3 PSD, scintillator, fission chamber, proportion counter, ion chamber, ccd, pixel, image plate, CMOS, …

manufacturer.ESRF_description: Name of the manufacturer of the detector. Example: Dectris

model.ESRF_description: Model of the detector. Example: Pilatus3_6M

live_time.ESRF_description: Time the detector has been actually measuring (elapsed_time - dead_time)

elapsed_time.ESRF_description: Time elapsed between start and stop of the measurement

calibration.ESRF_description: For MCA detectors, coefficients a, b, c to compute a scale based on channel number as a + b * x + c * x * x

x_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

y_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

layout.ESRF_description: How the detector is represented. Any of these values: point | linear | area

beam_center_x.ESRF_description: This is the x position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

beam_center_y.ESRF_description: This is the y position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

flatfield_applied.ESRF_description: True when the flat field correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

pixel_mask.ESRF_description: The 32-bit pixel mask for the detector

pixel_mask_applied.ESRF_description: True when the pixel mask correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

countrate_correction_applied.ESRF_description: Counting detectors usually are not able to measure all incoming particles, especially at higher count-rates. Count-rate correction is applied to account for these errors.

saturation_value.ESRF_description: The value at which the detector goes into saturation. Especially common to CCD detectors, the data is known to be invalid above this value.

threshold_energy.ESRF_description: Single photon counter detectors can be adjusted for a certain energy range in which they work optimally. This is the energy setting for this.

sensor_material.ESRF_description: At times, radiation is not directly sensed by the detector. Rather, the detector might sense the output from some converter like a scintillator. This is the name of this converter material.

bit_depth_readout.ESRF_description: How many bits the electronics reads per pixel. With CCD’s and single photon counting detectors, this must not align with traditional integer sizes. This can be 4, 8, 12, 14, 16,

distance.ESRF_description: This is the distance to the previous component in the instrument; most often the sample. The usage depends on the nature of the detector: Most often it is the distance of the detector assembly. But there are irregular detectors. In this case the distance must be specified for each detector pixel.

frame_time.ESRF_description: This is time for each frame. This is exposure_time + readout time.

acquisition_mode.ESRF_description: The acquisition mode of the detector. Any of these values: gated,triggered,summed,event,histogrammed,decimated

group.ESRF_description: Names and parameters describing the ROIs applied
group.name: ${InstrumentDetector01Rois_name}

value.ESRF_description: Parameters defining the ROI. Format: R1P1,R1P2 R2P1,R2P2 ... RnP1,RnP2

type.ESRF_description: Description of type such as He3 gas cylinder, He3 PSD, scintillator, fission chamber, proportion counter, ion chamber, ccd, pixel, image plate, CMOS, …

manufacturer.ESRF_description: Name of the manufacturer of the detector. Example: Dectris

model.ESRF_description: Model of the detector. Example: Pilatus3_6M

live_time.ESRF_description: Time the detector has been actually measuring (elapsed_time - dead_time)

elapsed_time.ESRF_description: Time elapsed between start and stop of the measurement

calibration.ESRF_description: For MCA detectors, coefficients a, b, c to compute a scale based on channel number as a + b * x + c * x * x

x_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

y_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

layout.ESRF_description: How the detector is represented. Any of these values: point | linear | area

beam_center_x.ESRF_description: This is the x position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

beam_center_y.ESRF_description: This is the y position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

flatfield_applied.ESRF_description: True when the flat field correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

pixel_mask.ESRF_description: The 32-bit pixel mask for the detector

pixel_mask_applied.ESRF_description: True when the pixel mask correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

countrate_correction_applied.ESRF_description: Counting detectors usually are not able to measure all incoming particles, especially at higher count-rates. Count-rate correction is applied to account for these errors.

saturation_value.ESRF_description: The value at which the detector goes into saturation. Especially common to CCD detectors, the data is known to be invalid above this value.

threshold_energy.ESRF_description: Single photon counter detectors can be adjusted for a certain energy range in which they work optimally. This is the energy setting for this.

sensor_material.ESRF_description: At times, radiation is not directly sensed by the detector. Rather, the detector might sense the output from some converter like a scintillator. This is the name of this converter material.

bit_depth_readout.ESRF_description: How many bits the electronics reads per pixel. With CCD’s and single photon counting detectors, this must not align with traditional integer sizes. This can be 4, 8, 12, 14, 16,

distance.ESRF_description: This is the distance to the previous component in the instrument; most often the sample. The usage depends on the nature of the detector: Most often it is the distance of the detector assembly. But there are irregular detectors. In this case the distance must be specified for each detector pixel.

frame_time.ESRF_description: This is time for each frame. This is exposure_time + readout time.

acquisition_mode.ESRF_description: The acquisition mode of the detector. Any of these values: gated,triggered,summed,event,histogrammed,decimated

group.ESRF_description: Names and parameters describing the ROIs applied
group.name: ${InstrumentDetector02Rois_name}

value.ESRF_description: Parameters defining the ROI. Format: R1P1,R1P2 R2P1,R2P2 ... RnP1,RnP2

type.ESRF_description: Description of type such as He3 gas cylinder, He3 PSD, scintillator, fission chamber, proportion counter, ion chamber, ccd, pixel, image plate, CMOS, …

manufacturer.ESRF_description: Name of the manufacturer of the detector. Example: Dectris

model.ESRF_description: Model of the detector. Example: Pilatus3_6M

live_time.ESRF_description: Time the detector has been actually measuring (elapsed_time - dead_time)

elapsed_time.ESRF_description: Time elapsed between start and stop of the measurement

calibration.ESRF_description: For MCA detectors, coefficients a, b, c to compute a scale based on channel number as a + b * x + c * x * x

x_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

y_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

layout.ESRF_description: How the detector is represented. Any of these values: point | linear | area

beam_center_x.ESRF_description: This is the x position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

beam_center_y.ESRF_description: This is the y position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

flatfield_applied.ESRF_description: True when the flat field correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

pixel_mask.ESRF_description: The 32-bit pixel mask for the detector

pixel_mask_applied.ESRF_description: True when the pixel mask correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

countrate_correction_applied.ESRF_description: Counting detectors usually are not able to measure all incoming particles, especially at higher count-rates. Count-rate correction is applied to account for these errors.

saturation_value.ESRF_description: The value at which the detector goes into saturation. Especially common to CCD detectors, the data is known to be invalid above this value.

threshold_energy.ESRF_description: Single photon counter detectors can be adjusted for a certain energy range in which they work optimally. This is the energy setting for this.

sensor_material.ESRF_description: At times, radiation is not directly sensed by the detector. Rather, the detector might sense the output from some converter like a scintillator. This is the name of this converter material.

bit_depth_readout.ESRF_description: How many bits the electronics reads per pixel. With CCD’s and single photon counting detectors, this must not align with traditional integer sizes. This can be 4, 8, 12, 14, 16,

distance.ESRF_description: This is the distance to the previous component in the instrument; most often the sample. The usage depends on the nature of the detector: Most often it is the distance of the detector assembly. But there are irregular detectors. In this case the distance must be specified for each detector pixel.

frame_time.ESRF_description: This is time for each frame. This is exposure_time + readout time.

acquisition_mode.ESRF_description: The acquisition mode of the detector. Any of these values: gated,triggered,summed,event,histogrammed,decimated

group.ESRF_description: Names and parameters describing the ROIs applied
group.name: ${InstrumentDetector03Rois_name}

value.ESRF_description: Parameters defining the ROI. Format: R1P1,R1P2 R2P1,R2P2 ... RnP1,RnP2

type.ESRF_description: Description of type such as He3 gas cylinder, He3 PSD, scintillator, fission chamber, proportion counter, ion chamber, ccd, pixel, image plate, CMOS, …

manufacturer.ESRF_description: Name of the manufacturer of the detector. Example: Dectris

model.ESRF_description: Model of the detector. Example: Pilatus3_6M

live_time.ESRF_description: Time the detector has been actually measuring (elapsed_time - dead_time)

elapsed_time.ESRF_description: Time elapsed between start and stop of the measurement

calibration.ESRF_description: For MCA detectors, coefficients a, b, c to compute a scale based on channel number as a + b * x + c * x * x

x_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

y_pixel_size.ESRF_description: Size of each detector pixel. If it is scalar all pixels are the same size.

layout.ESRF_description: How the detector is represented. Any of these values: point | linear | area

beam_center_x.ESRF_description: This is the x position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

beam_center_y.ESRF_description: This is the y position where the direct beam would hit the detector. This is a length and can be outside of the actual detector. The length can be in physical units or pixels as documented by the units attribute.

flatfield_applied.ESRF_description: True when the flat field correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

pixel_mask.ESRF_description: The 32-bit pixel mask for the detector

pixel_mask_applied.ESRF_description: True when the pixel mask correction has been applied in the electronics, false otherwise.

countrate_correction_applied.ESRF_description: Counting detectors usually are not able to measure all incoming particles, especially at higher count-rates. Count-rate correction is applied to account for these errors.

saturation_value.ESRF_description: The value at which the detector goes into saturation. Especially common to CCD detectors, the data is known to be invalid above this value.

threshold_energy.ESRF_description: Single photon counter detectors can be adjusted for a certain energy range in which they work optimally. This is the energy setting for this.

sensor_material.ESRF_description: At times, radiation is not directly sensed by the detector. Rather, the detector might sense the output from some converter like a scintillator. This is the name of this converter material.

distance.ESRF_description: This is the distance to the previous component in the instrument; most often the sample. The usage depends on the nature of the detector: Most often it is the distance of the detector assembly. But there are irregular detectors. In this case the distance must be specified for each detector pixel.

acquisition_mode.ESRF_description: The acquisition mode of the detector. Any of these values: gated,triggered,summed,event,histogrammed,decimated
